page.title: 19Captain Cook.
page.content: Captain Cook has had a great influence on our village.Tourist who vist the area will find the following connections.Born on the{27th October {1728,}Captain Cook went to school in {Great Ayton.}The school room is now a museum where you can read and look at his child_hood and also about his sailing adventures.The museum contains Cook's maps and personal possessions which include his tobacco box and a cup made out of a wild animals horn. An old obelisk stands at the start of Easby Lane.This marks the spot where Captain Cook's father's house used to be.Captain Cook's mother is buried in the grave yard of All Saints Church. After he left school he went to work at Airyholme farm on the slopes of Roseberry Topping.On{Easby moor walkers can see a great monument in memory of{Captain James Cook.
